Char vs. Attributes
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Char vs. Attributes
By Slugg on Wednesday, November 27, 2002 - 07:41 am:

Hello all. I've been scouring the boards here for a bit of time now to try to find an answer to my question. Forgive me if I repeat anything that has been said, but I do not think I noticed my question in previous posts. I'm sort of a newb at MR3, having raised 1.5 monsters thus far. However my question has to do with Characteristics vs. Attributes. I have generated well over 1000 monsters and have come up with a vast array of monsters. Now, with the encyclopedia saving one of each type of monster, should I be looking to save the monster with the higher stat attributes or the one with more [better] characteristics. I've seen on the boards that you can gain more characteristics in different locations, but the same can be true for good training making up any lacking stat points. I would like some of the more experienced players to give me their input on this matter, since I have yet to see these two parts of the same monster compared to each other.

I am well aware of 60 stat points being better off than choosing the monster with the extra hypotension, and for all intensive purposes say it would be a 40 point differential vs a characteristic like Iron Heart or a Fire Wisdom, Resists Cold, etc.
Thanks.

By torey luvullo on Wednesday, November 27, 2002 - 08:46 am:

A lot is going to depend on your approach to the game, slugg. I now raise monsters pretty much solely to compete in tourneys. I use the dmm/campster method. So i figure that i can always compensate for a stat deficit - it will just add extra time to the tedium that is dmm-ing. However, a bad char can last forever - even be passed on when i pass on the heart.

So, given what i am trying to accomplish, i never take a bad char into my encyclopedia if i have any choice at all.

By Corpse on Wednesday, December 4, 2002 - 01:40 pm:

I always take chars over stats. Recently, I shrined up the third disk of the Lord of the Rings 4-DVD collection, and kept the Drydon that came off of it just because it had "Sharp Edge", a char I never seen before. (the previous Drydon had something like a 100+ composite advantage over the LOTR Drydon)

By Slugg on Thursday, December 5, 2002 - 07:26 am:

O.k. The fact that chars stay on a monster even through hearts make it an obvious choice and one I really should of thought of sooner. Thanks for the input.
